intro: Phlegmariurus cryptomerinus, commonly known as the cryptomerine clubmoss, is a species of lycopod that belongs to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is a small, evergreen plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its clustered, spore-bearing cones and needle-like leaves. Its reproductive structures are arranged in compact, cylindrical clusters called strobila, which produce spores for propagation. This ancient plant is an important component of the understory vegetation in many temperate and tropical ecosystems.
